Package eu.fbk.st.cryptoac.elements

Class User

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.fbk.st.cryptoac.elements.CryptoACElement
      • eu.fbk.st.cryptoac.elements.CryptoACActiveElement
        • eu.fbk.st.cryptoac.elements.User
  • public final class User
extends CryptoACActiveElement
    Wrapper class for the users in the Access Control System. This is also the central class in the system, since it implements all the methods for interacting with the DAO. Note that all of these methods return an OperationOutcomeCode, to indicate whether the operation was successful or not

    • Method Detail

      • addUser

        public OperationOutcomeCode addUser​(@NotNull
                                    @NotNull java.lang.String newUsername,
                                    @NotNull
                                    @NotNull java.security.PublicKey newUserPublicKey)
        This method invokes the DAO to insert a new user into the storage. It also checks the given parameters Note: if the user (as physical person using this program) is the administrator, this function adds the user ID to the database (and ignores the public key field). Instead, if the user is a normal client, this function adds the public key of the user to the database. The role of the user is specified in the "cryptoac.properties" file Note also that, even though a client can change this property to impersonate the administrator, the Cloud policies should block such attempt (Depending on the implemented DAO).
        Parameters:
        newUsername - the new user username
        newUserPublicKey - the new user public key
        Returns:
        the outcome of the operation

      • deleteUser

        public OperationOutcomeCode deleteUser​(@NotNull
                                       @NotNull java.lang.String username)
        delete the given user through the DAO. This revokes all the roles from the user too Actually, it doesn't delete the user object (its public key may be used to verify signatures), just flag it
        Parameters:
        username - the Id of the user
        Returns:
        code for the outcome of the operation

      • addRole

        public OperationOutcomeCode addRole​(@NotNull
                                    @NotNull java.lang.String roleName)
        This method creates and insert a new role into the system through the DAO api. It creates the PKI keys, and the Role object. Then it encrypts the keys of the role and create and sign the role tuple
        Parameters:
        roleName - the name of the new role
        Returns:
        the numeric result of the operation

      • deleteRole

        public OperationOutcomeCode deleteRole​(@NotNull
                                       @NotNull java.lang.String roleName)
        delete the given role using the proper DAO. This affects both the role object and its tuples (delete role tuples and revoke all other permissions) Actually, it doesn't delete the role object, because its public key may be used to verify signatures. So jut flag it
        Parameters:
        roleName - the Id of the role
        Returns:
        code for the outcome of the operation

      • addFile

        public OperationOutcomeCode addFile​(@NotNull
                                    @NotNull java.lang.String fileName,
                                    @NotNull
                                    @NotNull java.lang.String filePath)
        This methods adds a new file to the cloud through the DAO api. It also creates the related tuples according to the referenced paper.
        Parameters:
        fileName - the name of the file (the ID)
        filePath - the path of the file on the file system
        Returns:
        the numeric result of the operation

      • deleteFile

        public OperationOutcomeCode deleteFile​(@NotNull
                                       @NotNull java.lang.String fileName)
        delete the given file using the proper DAO. This also deletes all the related permission tuples
        Parameters:
        fileName - the Id of the file
        Returns:
        code for the outcome of the operation

      • assignUserToRole

        public OperationOutcomeCode assignUserToRole​(@NotNull
                                             @NotNull java.lang.String username,
                                             @NotNull
                                             @NotNull java.lang.String roleName)
        This function assigns a user to a role (thus it creates a new RoleTuple).
        Parameters:
        username - the username of the user to bind
        roleName - the roleName of the role to bind
        Returns:
        numeric outcome of the operation

      • revokeUserFromRole

        public OperationOutcomeCode revokeUserFromRole​(@NotNull
                                               @NotNull java.lang.String username,
                                               @NotNull
                                               @NotNull java.lang.String roleName)
        remove the given user from the given role. This implies various modifications to the existing tuples (see referenced paper for details) Note: because of possible constraints in the database related to the primary keys, this function first GET the tuples, then DELETE the old ones, eventually it INSERT the new ones.
        Parameters:
        username - the Id of the user
        roleName - the Id of the role
        Returns:
        code for the outcome of the operation

      • assignPermissionToRole

        public OperationOutcomeCode assignPermissionToRole​(@NotNull
                                                   @NotNull java.lang.String roleName,
                                                   @NotNull
                                                   @NotNull java.lang.String fileName,
                                                   @NotNull
                                                   @NotNull Permission permissionToBeGiven)
        This function assigns a permission to a role (thus it creates a new PermissionTuple).
        Parameters:
        roleName - the roleName of the role to give the permission to
        fileName - the path of the file the role is being assigned permission over
        permissionToBeGiven - the permission to be given to the role, either R or RW
        Returns:
        numeric outcome of the operation:

      • revokePermissionFromRole

        public OperationOutcomeCode revokePermissionFromRole​(@NotNull
                                                     @NotNull java.lang.String roleName,
                                                     @NotNull
                                                     @NotNull java.lang.String fileName,
                                                     @NotNull
                                                     @NotNull Permission permission)
        remove the given permission (over the given file) from the given role. This implies various modifications to the existing tuples (see referenced paper for details)
        Parameters:
        roleName - the Id of the role
        fileName - the Id of the file
        permission - the permission to remove ("RW" or "W")
        Returns:
        code for the outcome of the operation

      • readFile

        public java.lang.String readFile​(@NotNull
                                 @NotNull java.lang.String fileName,
                                 @NotNull
                                 @NotNull java.lang.String pathWhereToSaveFile)
        This methods downloads and decrypt (if possible) a file from the cloud through the DAO api
        Parameters:
        fileName - the name identifying the file in the cloud
        pathWhereToSaveFile - where the file will be saved?
        Returns:
        the path of the decrypted file or null for any error (check logs for details)

      • writeFile

        public OperationOutcomeCode writeFile​(@NotNull
                                      @NotNull java.lang.String fileName,
                                      @NotNull
                                      @NotNull java.lang.String newFilePath)
        this method updates the given file in the cloud by writing the new version
        Parameters:
        fileName - the Id of the file to overwrite
        newFilePath - the path of the new file of the new version of the file (unencrypted, in plain text)
        Returns:
        code for the outcome of the operation

        public java.lang.String getFields()
